caption: Very neat and accessible restaurant. They offer generous meals and for economical rates. I liked the menu very much and the staff were very personal and informative. Recommended.
Exceptional and tasty food, I love the atmosphere this place has, and the staff members were welcoming. I will surely come back in the future.
**Ordered takeout during COVID pandemic  Food *Kimchi (appetizer) - OK *Pai Tan Ramen (Chashu pork; added Enoki mushrooms) - good overall; nice portion; broth a little salty
My favorite ramen spot in Brooklyn. The Classic Shoyu Ramen is my go-to. Their gyoza is also amazing!
Ramen are good! Portions big. Service super nice.

i was craving for some ramen and ordered from this place late night.  The portion of the dumpling were so small and i paid $8. it was definitely not worth of the price. i also got the signature ramen and it was fine. the quality was nothing special. i would give it a 3 star overall but...2 hours later, my stomach hurts so badly and i had to used the restroom twice in a row.  I immediately think of the food from this place because i didn't have anything today except buying from this place. i figured i need to write a review about it for my experience.

My wife and I love this place. The gyoza, the fried rice, everything is good. But the Ramen is fantastic.  It's basically a weekly staple for us. Or any cold rainy day. Or any day we're looking for some recovery food.  Our favorites are the Miso Ramen with spicy ground pork, and the Pai Tan  with chashu pork. Both excellent. And the chashu is better than most places I've been.  We walk by the shop all the time, and it's always a question of "should we get some?". And it's also awesome to see how many orders are always ready for pickup as there seems to be a steady stream of other ramen lovers as well.
This spot is amazing and broad, the meals was delicious and the rates were very affordable. quickly, effective service and very amiable waiters. I recommend this place.
Simply AMAZING Food Customer Service is Amazing

Really good place with outdoor seating. Friendly staff. Had Feed Squid Tentacles (which was very good), Kimchi Ramen (felt it could have a bit more sour but it was still good), and Shoyu Ramen (it was really good).

This is certainly one of the coolest restaurants in the area. Always when I come there I am profoundly pleased. They maintain their high  standard service and the highest level of dishes  they provide. You will be always satisfied with this restaurant. Highly  recommended.

I’ve been wanting to try this place, so I finally ordered some delivery today. Everything was packed with lots of care, arrived quickly/still hot, and the portions were big. The kimchi ramen was really good and so were the okonomiyaki style tater tots that I couldn’t resist trying! Ramen is always a bit of a splurge but I’d definitely like to try more from them next time I’m in the mood to treat myself. It’s nice to have a good ramen option not too far from home!

Let me start this by saying, I've waited a very long time to write any sort of review. I LOVE THIS PLACE! I've ordered pickup/delivery probably 100 times. I've dined in 3. Every single time the food has been so good. They have great portions, good quality, and decent priced food. I eat meat, but I have found almost every one of their vegetarian options to be amazing. I haven't even tried the other ramens because I love the veggie one so much. This place is awesome and definitely caters to the non meat eaters.

This Ramen was surprisingly good! The distinguishing factor is that unlike other restaurants, South Slope Ramen's chashu is quite large yet doesn't compromise for it's quality: it's both flavorful and tender.

Let me say this... this place is the best place i get my ramen from in Brooklyn!! And i eat ramen for the ingredients it brings. So far the portions are huge compare to other restaurants.. good people im coming back !

Biological Microchips in food. It tastes good but Operatives will project Electro magnetic fields while you are outside eating the food and do in body particle manipulation and place them in a neural path so they can be activated later to receive and be controlled by WiFi signals.

You would think for their prices, that it would be equal to or larger portions to places of comparative value.  Honestly, this charged me $5 for a slice of Cheesecake. The slice I got looked like half of a half and it was a complete disrespect for them to call this a serving at all. I uploaded the picture next to a gift card for comparison of how small that slice was. Be ashamed of advertising something like this, because it was incredibly disrepectful to see something so small when your presentation in pictures is significantly misleading. I have screenshots from UberEats also to prove how misleading this is.  If you can't afford to provide decent portions, take it off the menu, or decrease the price. Completely offensive to any consumer
They have very good vegetarian ramen (can you say yummy yummy in my tummy?!). Chill place in the pre-corona times. Now, fast delivery with nice sized portions. 👉🏼 🍜 👍🏼👅😋
Very nice
My favorite spot

For many years we went to the local favorite Men Kui Tei on 56th and 6th in Manhattan, before kids and after kids.  But it's a trek.  We discovered SSR right before the pandemic and we are so glad we are able to have delicious and authentic ramen without going too far now.  This place rivals (and in our opinion, better) than Ippudo, Toto, and some of the trendy ramen places without the line.  Their plain chicken broth kodomo ramen is perfect for kids (and cheaper).  The summer/cold noodles are excellent.  Shoyu ramen is my favorite.  Highly recommend.

We met with friends at this spot for dinner. my friend recommended this place.  Well, we were not disappointed. The staff welcomed us with a smile and we felt excellent. The meal was fresh and delicious. We had a great time and we shall definitely come back again. We recommend this place to all.
Awesome atmosphere and super amiable service. The food was crisp and enchanting. Will definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends. Convenient rates and big portions. Keep it up.
Food is hot, tasty, a good price and comes out fast! Can’t go wrong!
I had the pork ramen it was a big bowl very tasty...a little salty for my taste.  It's pricier than most.  Overall good seating and selections.
The food has no soul. Bland broth, lifeless vegetables. You are better off with Cup of Noodles.  The other positive reviews here are probably fake.
New place that is a welcome to the neighborhood!
Small, quiet place, good food
Ordered chicken ramen really good and tasty will order again
Best ramen in the neighborhood!

Phenomenal! The food is amazing, they accommodate to your preferences. Perfectly good food and tasty. Customer service is wonderful, they communicate amongst themselves. As well as communicate with there customers when they are busy, but verify them that they will be attended shortly. It's worth going! Not only for the delicious food, yet the environment is polite and welcoming. #chickenteriyaki #withCHAHANrice
(Translated by Google) Tan tan ramen & cha han fried rice 🔥  (Original) Tan tan ramen & cha han fried rice 🔥
Super tasty ramen!
The miso ramen and the gyoza were great. Prices are also pretty reasonable.

I been to many restaurants in New York City .. But I found this place really amazing.. The food was amazing and the price is really good If anyone haven’t try this restaurant you all should check this out 😍😍
Have eaten in and have ordered take out here. Great ramen. I particularly like their bone based broths and awesome Gyoza! It’s definitely my go to Ramen spot moving forward.

Outstanding ramen. This is a new small cozy joint. The ramen is tender, but not overly chewy; the broth is very rich and flavorful, yet not salty. You choose the type of meat for your ramen and they give you a decent amount of the toppings, which compliment the ramen and broth really well.
Decent Ramen in South Slope. The place is not packed and quiet. So you can have a serene moment with your warm bowl of ramen
Nice menu and sweet local feel, the ramen was killer.
Excellent!!
I loved the ramen! It’s nothing too fancy, but hearty and impeccable. Hope they will do well. This neighborhood is lacking in Asian food.
Amazing service and even better food!!!!
One of the best ramen places ive ever been too!

Stopped by with my kids for lunch on a whim.  The food was delicious and the service friendly and prompt.  My kids loved the fried rice and ramen.  Actually, they only want to go here form now on for ramen. Will be back.
good service. gret ramen.

Absolutely terrible service. Over 2 hours for delivery that is less than 2 miles away. Staff continues to tell me he will be there soon. At this point it doesn't matter how the food taste.  Update: the food was excellent but the service was so frustrating I would still think twice before ordering

Have been looking forward to coming here,their warm bowl of miso ramen absolutely hit the spot. Staff was so friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. The yuzu cheesecake is to die for :) It's so nice to finally have a great ramen place so close to home,will definitely be coming again
Very Nice place, Family friendly , awesome food!
Ramen is on par with Naruto Ramen (also on 5th but around Garfield and 5th). However the toppings such as the egg and chashu pork are super good here. Great bowls of ramen overall.
This place was AWESOME! Everything we ordered was fantastic, the service is friendly and the prices are fair! Absolutely loved it!

This place is excellent. I try any new ramen I can and this place is hands down the best around. The goyza and kurabuto apps are amazing. Their signature ramen is a great broth and noodle. (Although definitely feels like it's got to be heavy in the unhealthy department, not unlike most ramen) The owner is really cool and he used to manage Naruto Ramen in parkslope.
Delicious poke bowls! We have not tried the Ramen yet, but it looks great. This spot has been our neighborhood go-to since they reopened in August!

The food was delicious. The place is very clean and the waiter was very polite and told me about lunch special. I live just two blocks from this restaurant and it’s definitely the best ramen place in the neighborhood.
If you like spicy get the kimchi ramen, one of the few places that serve it and it’s amazing

I had their signature ramen and their classic, friend Rice and Kate age (fried chicken). Food was delicious friend rice was very tasty, couldn't get enough of it.  Now their ramen, their pork slices practically melt mouth (Homer Simpson drool), soup base it's so rich & creamy for their signature dish. Will Def be coming back here, especially with the chilly weather around the corner?

We found this place on our way home from Red Hook. Perfect little spot for our ramen craving. Showed up with husband and 9mo baby. Staff were super nice and helpful. Had the miso ramen with char sui and loved it. Flavor was spot on, pork was tender, everything was delicious. The sweet and spicy chicken wings were also yummy, and not too spicy either. Husband loved his ramen as well. Baby loved the decor haha. Wish they were in our hood, we would be regulars!

Love that they have takoyaki! I went their second day so they were still figuring things out, hence the 4-star rating. Enjoyed the ramen overall. It’s not the best I’ve had, but it’s the best in the area for sure!  Update: This place is closed for now. I heard they had a kitchen fire and have been shut down for a little.
This is Park Slope.... not "South" Slope. You people can't rename a neighbor just because you moved here a couple years ago. This has always been Park Slope!!! SLOPE Park is on 19th Street.
Finally! A fantastic ramen restaurant in South Slope.

Try out this Japanese Ramen shop yesterday at their grand opening, soup base is one of the more authentic taste.  Not too salty, not too greasy.  Ramen is cooked to perfect tenderness.   Yummy!   The best part of it is the price!  Best bang for the bucks!
Very nice new place, good food. Had dinner at the opening night.
